title: Credit cloning
data:
**Credit cloning** is the act of dropping [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") in a shop to build up credit, and then removing the gold without erasing the credit. Then, the credit with the shopkeeper remains, and you have your gold back. There are several ways to accomplish this, mostly involving pets, but occasionally using hostile monsters as well. By repeatedly credit cloning and selling items to a shopkeeper, it is possible to get all of their gold, and then all of their items from the built-up credit.

Most pets will only pick up a single piece of gold, with gold-loving monsters being the exception. So you need to use a [container](/wiki/Container "Container") to allow the gold to be stolen as a group. This means a distinct advantage for [Rogues](/wiki/Rogues "Rogues") and [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologists "Archeologists"), who both start with an uncursed [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack"), and can therefore employ the technique of credit cloning right from the start, while other classes have to acquire some kind of [container](/wiki/Container "Container") first.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [1.1 Using pets](#Using_pets)
  - [1.2 Using hostile monsters](#Using_hostile_monsters)

- [2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 References](#References)

## Strategy

The [strategy](/wiki/Strategy "Strategy") of **credit cloning** is simple:

- Move all objects in the [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") to a single pile. Drop a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") item to prevent your [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") from moving on to it.
- Drop a bag of gold into the shop. The [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") will give you credit for the gold.
- Let your pet [steal](/wiki/Stealing_from_shops "Stealing from shops") the gold for you (a [leash](/wiki/Leash "Leash") or [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") is very helpful here).
- Go to the pile and buy as much as you can from your credit.
- Sell all the recently bought items, even items that you own. It helps to put all the merchandise in a second bag and drop it at once.
- You may need to buy and sell several times before you can exhaust your credit if you had a lot of starting credit.
- Put the old and new gold in a bag, drop the bag, and repeat letting your pet steal it.

Repeat the technique till the shopkeeper has no gold – you will know this because the shopkeeper offers you credit instead of gold when you try to sell the item – and you have enough credit to buy everything that you want from the shop.

The technique is very time consuming and should not be done if you don't have [slow digestion](/wiki/Slow_digestion "Slow digestion"), a good amount of [food](/wiki/Food "Food"), or a good relationship with your god. The slowest part is waiting for your pet to steal the gold, so a good starting quantity helps, too.

Credit cloning is more effective if you have a second bag - especially a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding"). You can put all your gold into the bag, along with as many items as your pet can carry (preferably expensive ones). You can then have your pet carry the bag outside the shop and resell the items over and over to get all the shopkeeper's gold very quickly.

The point is to steal gold instead of merchandise, since gold has the highest value-to-weight ratio of all items in the game (except artifacts and identified gems) and is universally accepted. However, in the beginning, you might need to have your pet steal items.

The best shops for credit cloning, therefore, are ones with lightweight expensive items like [rings](/wiki/Rings "Rings"), [wands](/wiki/Wands "Wands") and identified [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"). Delicatessens are probably the safest, because they stock food, but are also very time-consuming because the items are so cheap until you make much [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water"). General stores are also good because you can sell many of your own items at the beginning, increasing the size of the initial pile of gold.

### Using pets

Be careful that your pet doesn't starve to death while credit-cloning. If you are just starting a game and plan to credit clone, try not to let your pet pick up any items until you have reached a shop. By keeping the pet's [apport](/wiki/Apport "Apport") from decreasing prematurely, you optimize its shoplifting ability.

Sometimes your pet will not pick up your "stealing bag" because it is too heavy.

The table below uses carrying capacities copied from [Monster carrying capacity](/wiki/Monster_carrying_capacity "Monster carrying capacity") with a version of NetHack 3.6.6.

| Pet type                                       | Can carry unassisted | in uncursed [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") | in blessed [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") |
| ---------------------------------------------- | -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten")                | 51                   | 70                                                                  | 140                                                                |
| [housecat](/wiki/Housecat "Housecat")          | 68                   | 104                                                                 | 208                                                                |
| [large cat](/wiki/Large_cat "Large cat")       | 1000                 | 1968                                                                | 3936                                                               |
| [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog")    | 51                   | 70                                                                  | 140                                                                |
| [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog")                         | 137                  | 242                                                                 | 484                                                                |
| [large dog](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog")       | 1000                 | 1968                                                                | 3936                                                               |
| [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony")                      | 1000                 | 1968                                                                | 3936                                                               |
| [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse")                   | 1034                 | 2036                                                                | 4072                                                               |
| [warhorse](/wiki/Warhorse "Warhorse")          | 1241                 | 2450                                                                | 4900                                                               |
| [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") | 500                  | 968                                                                 | 1936                                                               |
| [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")                | 3103                 | 5974                                                                | 11948                                                              |

### Using hostile monsters

| Monsters which will pick up gold in shops                                                                                         |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") and [orc mummies](/wiki/Orc_mummies "Orc mummies")                      |
| [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") and [dwarf mummies](/wiki/Dwarf_mummies "Dwarf mummies") |
| [centaurs](/wiki/Centaur_\(monster_class\) "Centaur (monster class)")                                                             |
| [ogres](/wiki/Ogre_\(monster_class\) "Ogre (monster class)")                                                                      |
| [leprechauns](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun")                                                                                      |

Certain monsters will pick up gold in a shop. These monsters will chase you into shops where you have left a pile of gold (this time, not in a bag). Once they have picked up the gold, they will follow you out of the shop, where you can kill them, retrieve the gold, and repeat. Just as with pets, shopkeepers will show no alarm when these monsters swipe from them.

Some strategies for this:

- Whenever paying for *anything* in a shop, it is better to drop the money on the ground and pay out of your credit, rather than paying directly.
- When you are in the shop, the shopkeeper may stand on the square just inside the door and block the monsters from entering the shop. They will step aside from this square if you are in a direct line with it and at least a full square away from it.
- Some monsters, especially orcs and dwarves, will sense gold buried in the earth and loiter near it rather than following you to a shop. Dropping a trail of single gold coins will induce them to follow you.
- Occasionally a monster will have already picked up so much weight (rocks, armor) that they will not be able to pick up any gold.
- In a shop with gold on the floor, monsters may choose to chase and attack you, rather than picking up the gold. If you have placed the gold anywhere but in a corner, you can get them to follow you until they are standing on the gold. Move to a space where they are not in a direct line with you (e.g. a knight's move away.) They will then pick up the gold.
- Pets are actually a hindrance to this strategy; they tend to kill the monsters before the monsters have left the shop. So lock up your pets or strand them on an adjacent level.
- [Orc shamans](/wiki/Orc_shaman "Orc shaman") may also swipe magical items as well as gold.
- Applying a [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") of a gold loving monster or casting [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on a statue of one inside of a shop is another method. Leprechauns are usually the only monster small enough to make transporting the statue feasible, however. This is of little use in vanilla NetHack, but is one of the few ways to credit clone in the [black market in SLASH'EM](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)").

## SLASH'EM

Credit cloning is slightly more difficult in SLASH'EM than in vanilla, but also significantly more useful. The [shopkeeper services](/wiki/Shopkeeper_services "Shopkeeper services") mean that it is useful to have credit in a shop even after the shopkeeper's gold has been exhausted and all useful items have been purchased. Pets are no longer guaranteed to pick up an entire pile of gold, so it is no longer possible to simply drop a pile of gold and have your pet kitten pick it up. It is necessary to place the gold into a sack or other container first. Fortunately, the shopkeeper identification service makes it much easier to identify valuable gems, and the massive increase in magic lamp price makes draining gold from shops quick if one is generated.

## History

In NetHack 3.4.3, a pet could pick up an entire stack of gold, eliminating the need for one of the bags.

## References
